President Uhuru Kenyatta: s claims about the Covid-19 positivity rate in August and September did not match the data provided by experts.
The positivity rate for Covid: 19 in Kenya reached 13% in July, not June as claimed by the President.
The President: s estimate of an 8% positivity rate in August was closer to the actual data.
Reaching a 5: Covid-19 positivity rate is not the only recommendation by the WHO to guide the reopening of an economy, as other factors must be considered.
